label: Recognize slow spoken greetings
description: Can recognize very common greetings (e.g., 'Hello', 'Good morning') when spoken slowly and clearly.
rubric: Identify greetings in slow, clear speech

label: Follow simple classroom instructions with pauses
description: Can understand very simple classroom instructions (e.g., 'Sit down', 'Open your book') if spoken slowly with pauses.
rubric: Follow basic classroom instructions spoken slowly

label: Identify slow spoken numbers and times
description: Can recognize basic numbers and telling the time when spoken slowly and with pauses.
rubric: Identify numbers and times in slow speech

label: Catch key ideas in slow conversations about family & hobbies
description: Can recognize very common words and fixed expressions when other people discuss family members or simple hobbies, provided the delivery is slow and clear.
rubric: Identify the main topic (family or hobby) from a short, slow exchange
Pick out at least one key word (e.g., mother, football, music) correctly

label: Catch key ideas in slow school-related conversations
description: Can understand some very basic expressions when other people talk about school (classes, teachers, timetable) if speech is slow and clear.
rubric: Identify the school-related topic (e.g., math class, teacher’s name)
Answer a yes/no question about a key detail (e.g., 'Is it math class?')

label: Catch key ideas in slow conversations about surroundings
description: Can recognize simple expressions when other people talk about immediate surroundings (home, classroom, street) if speech is slow and clear.
rubric: Identify the place being discussed (home/classroom/street) from short dialogue
Select one concrete detail mentioned (e.g., 'door', 'desk', 'bus')

label: Understand slow explanations about places on a guided tour
description: Can grasp very simple information when a guide points out places or landmarks during a slow, clear tour with pauses.
rubric: Identify the place being described (e.g., park, museum, church).
Point to or select a picture of the landmark when named.

label: Understand very simple instructions given to a group
description: Can follow basic group instructions in a slow, clear talk (e.g., 'Please wait here', 'Follow me').
rubric: Follow an instruction like 'Please stand here' in a tour setting.
Recognize direction words (e.g., left, right, stop).

label: Understand slow explanations about objects or exhibits
description: Can grasp very simple information when a guide describes basic objects (e.g., 'This is a chair', 'This is a painting') during a slow talk with pauses.
rubric: Identify the object described (e.g., painting, statue, chair).
Match simple vocabulary words from a tour talk to images.

label: Understand simple public announcements in school
description: Can recognize very simple school announcements (e.g., 'Class starts at 8 o’clock', 'The teacher is absent today') when spoken slowly and clearly.
rubric: Identify the topic of a basic school announcement.
Answer a yes/no question about the detail in the announcement.

label: Follow simple travel or transport announcements
description: Can understand basic transport announcements (e.g., 'The bus leaves at 5', 'Next stop is Central Station') if speech is slow and clear.
rubric: Recognize time or place mentioned in an announcement.
Match the announcement with the correct picture (bus, train).

label: Follow very basic safety or public instructions
description: Can follow very simple safety instructions (e.g., 'Please stand here', 'Do not run') when announced slowly and with pauses.
rubric: Follow an instruction like 'Please wait here'.
Identify the correct action in response to a safety instruction.

label: Understand very simple songs or rhymes
description: Can recognize a few familiar words and expressions in short children’s songs, rhymes, or chants if the delivery is slow and clear.
rubric: Identify a repeated word in a short rhyme.
Match a simple lyric to a corresponding picture.

label: Understand very short spoken recordings for learners
description: Can understand basic content in very short learner audios (e.g., self-introductions, classroom dialogues) if speech is slow and clearly articulated.
rubric: Identify the topic of a very short learner recording.
Answer one simple comprehension question (e.g., 'What is the name?').

label: Understand basic information in recorded announcements
description: Can grasp simple information from slow, clear recorded announcements (e.g., 'The store opens at 9', 'The train arrives at 5').
rubric: Recognize time or number mentioned in a recorded announcement.
Identify the place or action referred to in the audio.

label: Understand familiar words in children’s cartoons or shows
description: Can recognize a few familiar words, expressions, or repeated phrases in very simple children’s cartoons or shows when speech is slow and clear.
rubric: Identify a repeated word or phrase in a cartoon.
Point to the correct character when their name is spoken.

label: Understand very short educational video clips
description: Can understand basic content in short, slow educational videos (e.g., a video introducing numbers, colors, or classroom routines).
rubric: Identify the topic of the short educational video.
Answer one simple question (e.g., 'What color is this?').

label: Understand simple actions or settings in films/videos
description: Can grasp very basic information in films or videos about everyday actions or familiar settings (e.g., eating, walking to school, shopping) if images support comprehension.
rubric: Identify the action happening in the scene (e.g., eating, playing).
Match the spoken phrase to the correct visual scene.
